title.narrative: Responding to Earthquake-Affected Communities and Households in Nepal (REACH)

description.narrative:
Goal: Affected populations in Nepal are able to meet their basic needs and recover from the effects of the 2015 earthquakes
Objective: Earthquake-affected households access temporary shelter materials to help meet their immediate needs
Objective: Earthquake-affected communities regain their access to clean water and safe sanitation

Mercy Corps requests $1 million from OFDA to reach an estimated 17,500 women, men, girls and boys affected by the April 25 and May 12, 2015 earthquakes and subsequent aftershocks and landslides. Our proposed program focuses on emergency response interventions in the sectors of Shelter and Settlements and Water, Sanitation and Hygiene to help affected households, and communities recover from the effects of the earthquakes, while also working to stimulate local-level businesses and markets. Mercy Corps will provide necessary temporary shelter materials to affected households, as well as a one-time $75 cash transfer to enable households to meet their individually prioritized needs. Mercy Corps will only provide a one-time cash transfer as UNICEF and the government anticipate providing additional cash transfers. 4 UNICEF has stated that it will supplement the government’s social protection payments across 11 districts for an estimated 255,000 people, with two cashtransfers of $30 for eligible households scheduled for June and September. The government’s social protection transfers are approximately $5 to $10 per household with priority given to the elderly, people with disabilities and women-headed or single mother households. Mercy Corps will deliver cash transfers through local wholesale and retail networks, thereby also supporting the economic recovery of affected businesses. Mercy Corps and our implementing partner will raise awareness about proper hygiene through the distribution of Information, Education and Communication (IEC) materials, combined with improved access to sanitation facilities where appropriate.
